title.text: Spatial Lexicalization in the Translation of Prepositional Phrases

abstractContent.text: A pattern in the translation of locative prepositional phrases between English and Spanish is presented.

entities.text: translation of locative prepositional phrases between English and Spanish

abstractContent.text: A way of exploiting this pattern is proposed in the context of a multilingual machine translation system underdevelopment.

introductionContent.text: Two of the main problems in machine translation (MT) are ambiguity and lexical gaps.
Ambiguity occurs when a word in the source language (SL) has more that one translation into the target language (TL).
Lexical gaps occur when a word in one language cannot be translated directly into another language.
This latter problem is viewed by some as the key translation problem, (.
A casein point is the translation of prepositional phrases (PP).
The following entry for the translations into Spanish of the preposition along demonstrates this (entry taken from).

along: pot (by), a lo largo de (to the length of), segfin (according to) Both problems occur here: there are three different translations for the same English preposition, and the second of these is a phrase used to describe a sense of along which is not encoded as one word in Spanish.
